page.title: 11FISHING IN SANDWICK
page.content: A long time ago Sandwick was one of the important fishing areas in Shetland.Fishing boats were moored and there were several fishing stations at Broonies Taing where fish curers processed the fish caught. People travelled from all over Shetland to work for the fish curers and stayed in wooden huts built near the harbour. A new pier was built in 1903 at Broonies Taing to accomodate the fishing boats. Part of the slipway was demolished during the first world war as it was thought the pier would be vulnerable to enemy attack. Nowadays there are no fishing boats but several fiahermen in the area. Many small craft are used for leisure time fishing and fishing competitions.
